verses.kjv: And Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and the LORD his God was with him, and magnified him exceedingly.
verses.web: Solomon the son of David was firmly established in his kingdom, and LORD his God was with him, and made him exceedingly great.
verses.ct: Solomon son of David established firm control over his kingdom. The LORD his God was with him and made him extraordinarily great.

verses.kjv: Then Solomon spake unto all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every governor in all Israel, the chief of the fathers.
verses.web: Solomon spoke to all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, to the judges, and to every prince in all Israel, the heads of the fathers’ households.
verses.ct: Solomon summoned all of Israel — the commanders of thousands and hundreds, the judges, and every leader and family head across the nation.

verses.kjv: So Solomon, and all the congregation with him, went to the high place that was at Gibeon; for there was the tabernacle of the congregation of God, which Moses the servant of the LORD had made in the wilderness.
verses.web: So Solomon, and all the assembly with him, went to the high place that was at Gibeon; for God’s Tent of Meeting was there, which LORD’s servant Moses had made in the wilderness.
verses.ct: Then Solomon and the entire assembly traveled to the high place at Gibeon, because that's where God's Tent of Meeting was — the one Moses, the servant of the LORD, had built in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: But the ark of God had David brought up from Kirjathjearim to the place which David had prepared for it: for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
verses.web: But David had brought God’s ark up from Kiriath Jearim to the place that David had prepared for it; for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Now, David had already moved the ark of God from Kirjathjearim to Jerusalem, where he had set up a tent for it.

verses.kjv: Moreover the brasen altar, that Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, he put before the tabernacle of the LORD: and Solomon and the congregation sought unto it.
verses.web: Moreover the bronze altar that Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made was there before LORD’s tabernacle; and Solomon and the assembly were seeking counsel there.
verses.ct: The bronze altar that Bezaleel son of Uri, son of Hur, had crafted was still there in front of the LORD's tabernacle at Gibeon. So Solomon and the assembly went there to seek God.

verses.kjv: And Solomon went up thither to the brasen altar before the LORD, which was at the tabernacle of the congregation, and offered a thousand burnt offerings upon it.
verses.web: Solomon went up there to the bronze altar before LORD, which was at the Tent of Meeting, and offered one thousand burnt offerings on it.
verses.ct: Solomon approached the bronze altar before the LORD at the Tent of Meeting and offered 1,000 burnt offerings on it.

verses.kjv: In that night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto him, Ask what I shall give thee.
verses.web: That night, God appeared to Solomon and said to him, “Ask for what you want me to give you.”
verses.ct: That night God appeared to Solomon and said, "Ask me for whatever you want, and I'll give it to you."

verses.kjv: And Solomon said unto God, Thou hast shewed great mercy unto David my father, and hast made me to reign in his stead.
verses.web: Solomon said to God, “You have shown great loving kindness to David my father, and have made me king in his place.
verses.ct: Solomon replied, "You showed tremendous mercy to my father David, and now you've made me king in his place.

verses.kjv: Now, O LORD God, let thy promise unto David my father be established: for thou hast made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
verses.web: Now, LORD God, let your promise to David my father be established; for you have made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
verses.ct: LORD God, please keep the promise you made to my father David. You've made me king over a people as countless as the dust of the earth.

verses.kjv: Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people: for who can judge this thy people, that is so great?
verses.web: Now give me wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people; for who can judge this great people of yours?”
verses.ct: Give me wisdom and knowledge so I can lead these people well. Who could possibly govern a nation this great without your help?"

verses.kjv: And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thine heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of thine enemies, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee king:
verses.web: God said to Solomon, “Because this was in your heart, and you have not asked riches, wealth, honor, or the life of those who hate you, nor yet have you asked for long life; but have asked for wisdom and knowledge for yourself, that you may judge my people, over whom I have made you king,
verses.ct: God said to Solomon, "Because this is what your heart truly wanted — you didn't ask for riches, wealth, or honor, or for the death of your enemies, or even for a long life — but instead you asked for wisdom and knowledge to govern my people, the nation I made you king over —

verses.kjv: Wisdom and knowledge is granted unto thee; and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of the kings have had that have been before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like.
verses.web: therefore wisdom and knowledge is granted to you. I will give you riches, wealth, and honor, such as none of the kings have had who have been before you had, and none after you will have.”
verses.ct: wisdom and knowledge are yours. And on top of that, I'm giving you riches, wealth, and honor beyond anything any king before you ever had, and beyond anything any king after you will ever have."

verses.kjv: Then Solomon came from his journey to the high place that was at Gibeon to Jerusalem, from before the tabernacle of the congregation, and reigned over Israel.
verses.web: So Solomon came from the high place that was at Gibeon, from before the Tent of Meeting, to Jerusalem; and he reigned over Israel.
verses.ct: Solomon then left the high place at Gibeon, departing from the Tent of Meeting, and returned to Jerusalem, where he ruled over Israel.

verses.kjv: And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, which he placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
verses.web: Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen. He had one thousand four hundred chariots and twelve thousand horsemen that he placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Solomon built up a massive force of chariots and horsemen. He had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen, which he stationed in specially designated chariot cities and with him in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the king made silver and gold at Jerusalem as plenteous as stones, and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that are in the vale for abundance.
verses.web: The king made silver and gold to be as common as stones in Jerusalem, and he made cedars to be as common as the sycamore trees that are in the lowland.
verses.ct: Under Solomon's rule, silver and gold became as common as stones in Jerusalem, and cedar wood became as plentiful as the sycamore trees in the lowlands.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: the king’s merchants received the linen yarn at a price.
verses.web: The horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt and from Kue. The king’s merchants purchased them from Kue.
verses.ct: Solomon's horses were imported from Egypt and from Kue. The king's merchants purchased them from Kue at the going price.

verses.kjv: And they fetched up, and brought forth out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver, and an horse for an hundred and fifty: and so brought they out horses for all the kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, by their means.
verses.web: They brought up and brought out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred pieces of silver, and a horse for one hundred fifty. They also exported them to the Hittite kings and the Syrian kings.
verses.ct: A chariot imported from Egypt cost 600 shekels of silver, and a horse cost 150. Solomon's merchants also exported them to the Hittite kings and the kings of Syria.
